special_abilities: Small Stature: Difficulty targeting at long range
Quick Reflexes: Remove setback from Coordination
Nimble: One free rank in Coordination
All Aqualish are capable of breathing underwater.
They begin the game with one rank in Brawl. Characters cannot train Brawl above rank 2 during character creation.

Sub-Species Options: Aquala (begin with one rank in Resilience, can remove setback dice in cold/wet conditions), Ualaq (begin with one rank in Survival or Perception, can remove setback dice in dark conditions), Quara (begin with one rank in Athletics or Coercion, can remove setback dice when tracking in natural environments)
One rank in Vigilance
Mood Readers: Add boost to Charm/Negotiation
Heat resistance: Remove setback from arid conditions
One rank in Knowledge (Lore)
Proud and secretive nature
Strong spiritual traditions
Bothans begin the game with one rank in Streetwise. They still may not train Streetwise above rank 2 during character creation.
They also start with one rank in the Convincing Demeanor talent.
Cereans begin the game with one rank in Vigilance. They still may not train Vigilance above rank 2 during character creation.
Binary Processing: Cereans treat all Knowledge skills as career skills.
One rank in Negotiation
Advanced Olfaction: Enhanced smell tracking
Large size and thick hide
Chiss begin the game with one rank in Cool. They still may not train Cool above rank 2 during character creation.
Infravision: Chiss have adapted to be able to see in both the infrared and normal visual spectra. This enables Chiss characters to remove up to a setback die added to checks by lighting conditions.
One rank in Knowledge (Warfare)
One rank in Resilience
Kamino Training: One rank in Physical Training talent
One rank in Perception
Energy Sensitivity: Detect electromagnetic spectrum
Emotion sensing head cones
One rank in Coordination
One rank in Survival
Nightsister Magic: Access to unique Force abilities
One rank in Survival or Deception
Resilient Metabolism: Automatic boost to Resilience checks
Hardy physiology resistant to toxins
One rank in Knowledge (Education)
Problem solving bonus: Add boost to assistance
Small size and analytical mind
Inorganic: No bacta/stimpack healing, use Mechanics
Mechanical Being: Cannot use Force powers
Enduring talent
Enhanced skill training options
Duros begin the game with one rank in Piloting (Space). They still may not train Piloting (Space) above rank 2 during character creation.
Intuitive Navigation: Duros may add an advantage result to all Astrogation checks they make.
One free rank in Survival (cannot train above rank 2 during creation)
Small size: Melee defense of 1, add 1 setback die to combat checks against them at short range or engaged
Add 1 setback die to all Stealth checks they attempt
One rank in Charm
Beguiling Pheromones: Upgrade Charm/Deception/Negotiation
Color-changing skin and emotional manipulation
One free rank in Brawl (cannot train above rank 2 during creation)
Add 1 automatic success to all Brawl checks
Gand begin the game with one rank in Discipline. They still may not train Discipline above rank 2 during character creation.

Ammonia Breathers: Players choose between two subspecies - Lungless Gand (immune to suffocation but not vacuum wounds) or Lung-having Gand (start with ammonia respirator, treat oxygen as atmosphere Rating 8, gain +10 starting XP).
Gand.source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

special_abilities: One rank in Coercion or Vigilance
Cyborg: Start with up to two cybernetic implants
Mysterious species of mercenaries
One rank in Charm or Negotiation
Enhanced Vision: Remove setback from ranged combat/Perception
Three-eyed peaceful species
One rank in Athletics
Amphibious: Breathe underwater, no water movement penalties
Natural swimmers and aquatic fighters
Multiple Arms: Additional manipulation during encounters
Natural Climbers: Remove setback dice from climbing
Web Spinners: Can create web-based tools and traps
Two non-career skills of choice
Most adaptable and numerous species
Balanced characteristics
Enduring talent
Nobody's Fool talent
One rank in Coercion or Discipline
Ponderous: Cannot spend more than one maneuver moving
Nature Bond: Upgrade Knowledge (Xenology) checks for plants/animals
Sonic Bellow: Special Coercion attack using voice
Peaceful Nature: Extra conflict for combat actions
One rank in Athletics
Amphibious: Breathe underwater without penalty
Jaws: Brawl attacks deal +1 damage with Critical 3
Kel Dors begin the game with one rank in Knowledge (Education). They still may not train Knowledge (Education) above rank 2 during character creation.
Dark Vision: When making skill checks, Kel Dors remove up to two setback dice imposed due to darkness.

Atmospheric Requirement: Kel Dors must wear a specialized mask to breathe and see outside of their native atmosphere. A Kel Dor character starts the game with an antitox breath mask and treats oxygen as a dangerous atmosphere with Rating 8. However, Kel Dors may survive in vacuum for up to five minutes before suffering its effects.
One rank in Brawl, Ranged (Heavy), or Ranged (Light)
One additional rank in non-career skill of choice
Traditionally enslaved to Hutts
Force Sight: Ignore penalties from darkness and concealment; upgrade Perception checks at no cost for visual senses
Natural Force Sensitivity: Strong connection to the Force
Begin with one free rank in Discipline
Dedication (+10 XP to spend on Force Rating talent)
Strong in the Force (Begin with one Force power)
Amphibious: Can breathe underwater
Keen Vision: Enhanced visual capabilities
One rank in Knowledge (Education)
One rank in Knowledge (Core Worlds)
Deep Pockets: Start with additional 1,000 credits
Natural bankers and economists
Nautolans begin the game with one rank in Athletics. They still may not train Athletics above rank 2 during character creation.
Amphibious: Nautolans may breathe underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.
Five subspecies with different adaptations
Red Niktos: Desert adaptation
Green Niktos: Forest adaptation
Blue Niktos: Coastal adaptation
Pale Niktos: Mountain adaptation
Amphibious: Can breathe underwater
Ink Cloud: Once per encounter, create concealment cloud
Tentacle Dexterity: Additional manipulation capabilities
Rodians begin the game with one rank in Survival. They still may not train Survival above rank 2 during character creation.
Rodians start with one rank in the Expert Tracker talent.
Enhanced Senses: Upgrade Perception checks
Natural Trackers: Remove setback from tracking
Keen Hearing: Additional audio detection capabilities
One rank in Coordination
Glider: Can fall safely and glide over gaps
Four-eyed avian species
One rank in Coordination
Darkvision: Remove setback from darkness
Tail: Can be used as Brawl weapon
Fierce loyalty to family/den
Darkvision: Can see in low-light conditions
Expert Navigator: Bonuses to navigation checks
Keen Senses: Enhanced sensory capabilities
Sure-Footed: Improved balance and movement
Cold environment adaptations
Four arms for enhanced manipulation
Natural cold resistance

Montrals: Togruta have a pair of hollow horn-like projections called montrals that grow from the top of their heads. These montrals are used for echolocation. Togruta ignore the effects of all environmental conditions that would cause them to upgrade the difficulty of Perception checks once.
Natural Hunters: Add boost dice to checks to track or hunt prey
Silhouette 0: Smaller than average
Hoverer: Wings allow hovering and easier terrain navigation
Natural merchants and traders
Trandoshans begin the game with one rank in Perception. They still may not train Perception above rank 2 during character creation.

Regeneration: Whenever a Trandoshan would recover one or more wounds from natural rest or recuperation in a Bacta tank, they recover one additional wound. They do not recover one additional wound when receiving first aid or medical treatment from a character, or when using a stimpack. Trandoshans can regrow lost limbs as well, though it usually takes at least a month before the limb is usable.
Claws: When a Trandoshan makes Brawl checks to deal damage to an opponent, they deal +1 damage and have a Critical Rating of 3.
Twi'leks begin the game with one rank in either Charm or Deception. They still may not train Charm or Deception above rank 2 during character creation.
Desert Dwellers: When making skill checks, Twi'leks may remove a setback die imposed due to arid or hot environmental conditions.
Desert Dwellers: Remove setback dice from heat/desert environments
Pheromone Communication: Silent communication with other Weequay
Thick Hide: +1 soak value
Wookiees begin the game with oner rank in Brawl. They still may not train Brawl above rank 2 during character creation.
Wookiee Rage: When a Wookiee has suffered any wounds [they] deal +1 damage to Brawl and Melee attacks. When a Wookiee is Critically Injured, [they] instead deal +2 damage to Brawl and Melee attacks.
Wookiee.source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

special_abilities: Zabrak begin the game with one rank in Survival. They still may not train Survival above rank 2 during character creation.
Fearsome Countenance: Zabrak add an automatic advantage result to all Coercion checks the make.
Business Sense: Neimoidians add an automatic advantage to all Negotiation checks.
Cowardly: When a Neimoidian becomes the target of a combat check, they suffer 1 strain.
Natural Diplomats: Pantorans add an automatic advantage to all Charm and Negotiation checks.
Cold Adaptation: Pantorans can function normally in cold environments down to -30°C.
Memory Share: Caamasi can share specific memories with other Caamasi through touch.
Pacifist Tendencies: Caamasi upgrade the difficulty of all combat checks once.
Four Arms: Besalisks have four arms and may perform a maneuver to add an automatic advantage to their next Brawl or Melee combat check.
Thick Hide: Besalisks have +1 soak value.
Amphibious: Chagrians can breathe underwater and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.
Radiation Sensitivity: Chagrians upgrade the difficulty of all checks twice when exposed to radiation.
Precognition: Once per session, an Iktotchi may add two boost dice to any one check.
Desert Dweller: Iktotchi remove one setback die imposed due to arid or hot environmental conditions.
